title: GenPC: Zero-shot Point Cloud Completion via 3D Generative Priors
author: An Li (Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics), Zhe Zhu (Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics), Mingqiang Wei (Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics), ...
relevance_why: The techniques for point cloud completion and generative modeling could inform audio processing tasks where spatial representation and completion are paramount.
background: Point cloud completion is the task of reconstructing missing parts of a 3D object based on partial data often acquired through real-world scanning processes.
contribution: GenPC introduces a novel framework leveraging 3D generative priors for zero-shot completion of point clouds, achieving enhanced quality and inference speed over existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied heavily on 2D diffusion models and required extensive optimization for each input, leading to longer processing times and often poorer geometric fidelity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work reduces complexity by directly using a 3D generative model that provides explicit geometric priors, resulting in faster completion times and improved detail preservation.

key_innovation: Utilizes depth images to bridge the gap between 2D generative models and incomplete point clouds, ensuring geometric accuracy while inferring missing data.
real_world_impact: The approach can significantly enhance 3D model reconstruction in real-world applications such as robotics and augmented reality, thus facilitating better interaction with digital environments.

new_terms.Depth Prompting: **Depth Prompting** is a method introduced in this work to convert partial 3D data into depth images, acting as an intermediary for further analysis with 3D generative models.
new_terms.Geometric Preserving Fusion: **Geometric Preserving Fusion** refers to a technique that aligns generated shapes with input partial clouds to ensure structural integrity in the final output.
